quest.name: Toadskins of the Father
journal: Guildmaster Geva has a special request for an experienced leatherworker.

Displaying what could be misconstrued as guilt, Geva asks you to speak with a client whom she had forcibly removed from the guild prior to your arrival. Search Old Gridania for the poor fellow and obtain more information about his request.

It would seem Camillain, the client, purchased an Angrbotha-brand toadskin jacket to commemorate his son's acceptance into the Wood Wailers─only to discover that the garment was far from functional. In desperation, the hapless fellow turned to the Leatherworkers' Guild and begged them to complete his commission before his son's enlistment ceremony. Sadly, however, he found the guildmaster less than eager to listen to his tale. Speak with Geva and see what she has to say.

Moved by Camillain's story─and not at all by guilt─Geva bids you to create a high-quality toadskin jacket for the devoted father. Craft the item to the best of your ability and present it to Geva for inspection.
Geva judges your toadskin jacket a fitting gift for the young Wailer-to-be. Deliver the jacket to Camillain.
Camillain is overwhelmed by your gesture, praising your craftsmanship and declaring it the finest toadskin jacket he has ever seen. Return to Geva and inform her that the client is satisfied.

While pleased with your success, Geva is frustrated to hear that Angrbotha is continuing to prey upon customers' ignorance. She confides that she hopes the allure of greater notoriety will encourage them to participate in the forthcoming Gridanian exhibition, where they may be exposed and shamed as frauds.

※The next leatherworker quest will be available from Geva upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Present a toadskin jacket to Geva.
Deliver the toadskin jacket to Camillain.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename! Just the leatherworker I was looking for!

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Well, one of several I would consider asking─but that's beside the point.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Anyway, I have a task for you.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Mere moments ago, we received an older gentleman who demanded that we give his commission priority. Needless to say, I refused him without hesitation and had him thrown out. In retrospect, however, I believe his forwardness may have owed more to desperation than mere impatience...

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Could you, perhaps, speak with this client on my behalf? I am told he was last seen heading east, in the direction of the market stalls. Of course, he may have gone further than that, but being an energetic adventurer, I'm sure you'll find him eventually.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: You...you are a leatherworker? Thank you for coming to see me... I know that my behavior at the guild was inexcusable.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Permit me to start from the beginning. I heard tell of a new brand of leather goods that was cheaper than Fen–Yll but just as well made. Not being a wealthy man, I saw no reason to spend the extra gil, and purchased some of this Angrbotha-branded leather armor for my boy...only to be disappointed.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: To an untrained eye it may seem fit for purpose, but I served as a Wood Wailer for many years and could tell at a glance that it was no match for Ixali weapons.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Aye, they made it fast and cheap as advertised, but had I known the quality would be so bloody awful, I would have found the extra gil and gone to Fen–Yll Fineries in the first place.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: I know what I ask is unreasonable, but my boy is about to enlist in the Wailers, and I wanted to give him something that would last a lifetime─something that his son could wear when the time came. I swear, that Angrbotha stuff wouldn't keep him alive long enough to even have a son.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Please, would you make me a toadskin jacket?

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: I want my boy to remember the moment he becomes a Wailer for the rest of his life. Gods, if only I had gone to Fen–Yll Fineries first...

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: ...I see.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: A gift from father to son, to be passed down through the ages. Only a well-crafted item could be expected to carry generations of memories and tradition.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: ...A toadskin jacket, was it? Well, after hearing such a tale, who could possibly refuse? ...Why are you looking at me like that? It was a rhetorical question, Forename! I'm not a monster!

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: You heard his words, so you know what's at stake better than anyone. I bid you make a toadskin jacket of the highest possible quality and present it to me for inspection.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Remember what's at stake, Forename. We need a quality toadskin jacket that can withstand generations of wear and tear.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Hmmm... I daresay this is your best work yet.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: The spaulders and breast are made from the finest toadskin, and the goatskin backing alone would provide solid protection.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: It strikes the perfect balance between mobility and protection, and I can find no fault with it.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Aye, it's a fitting gift for a young Wailer-to-be.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I expect that Camillain will agree. Take it to him, Forename.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Why oh why did I have to think about the gil...? Everyone knows Fen–Yll goods are the best, and the best is no less than my son deserves. To think of him clad in that Angrbotha crap when he becomes a Wailer... <sigh>

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Praise the Matron, a toadskin jacket! I could not have hoped for such kindness!

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: And this craftsmanship is beyond compare...

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Not to be, this tag.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: Not to be, this tag.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: In fact, I do not believe I have ever seen finer leather equipment in all my years. My son will be thrilled to receive it!

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: A craftsman that had never known battle could not possibly have made a jacket like this. Tell me, misssir, are you...?

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: But of course. Even Geva has seen fit to welcome capable adventurers like yourself into her guild.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: I hope you will continue to share your gift with the people of Gridania, and give others the opportunity to savor your work.

dialogue.name: CAMILLAIN
dialogue.text: I have truly never seen such a fine toadskin jacket. I know my son will be thrilled to receive it. Thank you, adventurer.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I take it from your grin that Camillain was satisfied? Glad to hear it.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Gods, I'm getting fed up with this Angrbotha nonsense. First that Ul'dahn merchant, and now this.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Honestly, I don't know what idiotic plan they have in mind, but it's only a matter of time before word spreads. Quickly, cheaply produced goods may entice customers, but quality goods keep them.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I wonder if they'll even consider participating in the exhibition... On the one hand, there is no better way to publicize your brand, while on the other, they must surely know that they're in no position to compete with real leatherworkers.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: ...But I do hope they try, Forename. I would love nothing more than to see those Angrbotha frauds get their comeuppance─to look on as artisans and merchants from every corner of Eorzea cast judgment on their works and proclaim them a disgrace!
